text: El Clásico (; , ; ), is the name given to the basketball matches between Real Madrid from Madrid and FC Barcelona from Barcelona, the two main basketball teams from Spain. Both cities are separated by 621 km. ==Head-to-head statistics== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- ! background:#fff;"| 86 – 76 || Barcelona || 12,729 |- | 32 || 2 April 2020 || 33 || | Barcelona || || Real Madrid || |- |} ==Players who played for both clubs== Ante Tomić was the most recent player to transfer between the two rivals, in 2012. ;Barcelona then Real Madrid * 1956: Alfonso Martínez (via Aismalíbar Montcada) * 1956: José Luis Martínez (via Aismalíbar Montcada) * 1957: Rafael González-Adrio * 1959: Jordi Parra * 1964: Miguel "Ché" González * 1995: Santi Abad (via Taugrés Baskonia) * 1995: Zoran Savić (via PAOK Bravo) * 1999: Aleksandar Đorđević * 1999: José Luis Galilea (via León Caja España) * 2002: Alain Digbeu * 2002: Michael Hawkins (via Idea Śląsk) * 2002: Derrick Alston (via Pamesa Valencia) * 2008: Pepe Sánchez * 2013: Ioannis Bourousis (via EA7 Emporio Armani Milano) ;Real Madrid then Barcelona * 1958: Alfonso Martínez * 1958: José Luis Martínez * 1990: José "Piculín" Ortiz * 2002: Dejan Bodiroga (via Panathinaikos) * 2012: Ante Tomić * 2013: Maciej Lampe (via Caja Laboral) * 2019: Nikola Mirotić (via Milwaukee Bucks) {| class="wikitable" |- | width=260| From Barcelona to Real Madrid || style="text-align:center;
